item.title: Email to French law professor Yves Strickler
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: : Bonne Année! Date sent: January 27, 2023, 16:53 (Beijing time) To: Yves Strickler (French law professor) Cc: Many people including the FBI and the State Department, I will update this section later Dear Professor Strickler, Thank you for reminding me to pay close attention to compliance. You are absolutely right! Please don’t worry if you don’t immediately have the time to read all of the emails I am CCing to you regarding the pattern of racketeering activity McDonald’s Corporation has engaged into.

item.title: UPDATING - SEC Office of the Whistleblower, second complaint submitted on November 15, 2022
item.description: THIS IS BEING UPDATED; PLEASE COME BACK AT A LATER TIME (As of 2023-04-15, it’s currently not my priority any longer to finish updating this page. But if you have questions regarding this submission to the SEC, please feel free to contact me at x@ecthrwatch.org). I ADDED THIS ENTRY ON JANUARY 20, 2023. I WILL TRY TO ADD MORE INFORMATION SOON. SOME IMPORTANT NAMES ARE NOT INCLUDED YET IN THE LIST I SUBMITTED TO THE SEC, LIKE WHITE-COLLAR CRIMINAL NAWFAL TRABELSI.

item.title: “I sold my soul to McDonald’s”
item.description: This book contains a crucial evidence that McDonald’s Corporation executives could have easily, through a simple phone call, stop the ongoing frauds which were happening in France, and later in Europe. Then, why didn’t they? In addition to the fact that there is an undeniable proof that, contrarily to what Gloria Santona said, this was a French problem, the book offers additional insights about how McDonald’s seems to corrupt politicians. To gain a clearer understanding of the sequence of events in this case, I invite you to view a detailed timeline at the following link:
